Summary 
I am enthusiastic Gen Yer on an a unique journey as a Google Sales Engineer working along side large enterprise Clients.  
 
Beginning in a selective Google advertising program, followed by an sales internship which lead to my role as a Sales Engineer in the Google For Work Team.  
 
I pride my self on being a hard and fast learner, a curve ball thinker and tech tinker. 
 
Most importantly, I like to be challenged.

Assistant Roles include:

* Designing marketing collateral (Discipline Booklets, Faculty intranet, brochures, flyers, posters)

View Google Student Ambassador Google February 2013  –  February 2014  (1 year 1 month) Sydney Area, Australia The Google Student Ambassador Program (GSA) is a selective opportunity for students to act as a liaison between Google and their universities. As an Ambassador I am thrilled about new technology and enthusiastic about sharing Google products and culture on campus!  
 
Ambassador Roles include:  
* Learning about innovative Google products and programs 
* Planing and hosting fun events on campus with various student bodies and clubs 
* Maintaining and updating the GSA Google+ and Facebook accounts 
* Assisting UOW Information Technology Services (ITS) with implementing Google learning tools 
 
ACHIEVEMENTS: Presented Google Docs and Drive to a lecture theatre of over 300 staff and students at UOW. - International computer Lab enrollment assistant, O-Week (2012/2013) 
-	Contributed to the development of the University’s International advertising campaign  
 
Achievements: Selected to present a 15 minute formal speech at Orientation Day Autumn and spring 2013 in front of up to 300 hundred prospective business students, teachers and staff about my experiences as a university student. University of Wollongong- Faculty of Commerce Edit Student Speaker - 0 Week 2013 Edit Senior Retail Assistant Billabong July 2009  –  November 2013  (4 years 5 months) Wollongong Area, Australia -	Reached and exceeding large KPI’S and sales targets 
-	Handled large large product data bases  
-	Recruited and trained new staff  
-	Tackled daily business challenges including customer complaints, returns and exchanges

Achievements: Named Billabongs Lead Sales Persons 2012 for providing excellent customer service having accomplished large KPI’s, package selling and budgets. Student Tutor and Mentor - IN2UNI Program University of Wollongong March 2013  –  October 2013  (8 months) Wollongong Area, Australia In2Uni is a mentor support and outreach program developed by the Department of Education (DEC NSW) and the University of Wollongong (UOW) to enable students in low socio economic schools to participate and succeed in higher education. The university provides student mentors from Batmen's Bay to southern Sydney with the goal of increasing low SES university intake.  
 
Mentor Roles included:  
* Facilitating weekly 1 Hour lessons with up to 30 high school students from years 7-12  
* Implementing large-scale on campus events for high school students 
* Maintained partnerships and relationships with schools, community groups, parents, and sponsors 
* Assisted in administrative matters involved in the program including student databases  
* Delivered student experience speeches to participating IN2UNI schools 
 
ACHIEVEMENTS: (Open) 1 honor or award Rookie Of The year Award At the completion of my position as student mentor in the IN2UNI program in December 2013 I was nominated by my peers for the "Rookie of The Award". View Google AdCamp Google January 2013  –  January 2013  (1 month) Sydney Area, Australia Selected as one of 22 students nationally to participate in a four day introduction to Google's Advertising and Sales techniques. Among sessions taught by inspiring Googlers, I worked on a team challenge to develop a digital strategy for Target which was pitched to established Google leaders.  
 
Session topics included: 
* Googles 7 Point Sales Frame Work 
* Google Display Network (GDN), Audience Targeting & YouTube Advertising 
* Google Search, Clicks and AdWords, online restate 
* Analytics, measuring ROI and Ad Ranks 
* Advanced training in public speaking and sales pitching

View Google AdCamp: Australia and New Zealand 2013 Edit Google Ad Camp Day 1# Edit Public Relations Internship - Pulse & Howorth Ogilvy Public Relations Worldwide January 2012  –  March 2012  (3 months) Sydney Area, Australia Completed an internship with Ogilvy Public Relations working in the Public Relations sector across two divisions, Pulse (Consumer) and Howorth (B2B). I worked closely clients such as Microsoft, LG, Canon, Intel, Tremble. 
 
-	Monitored coverage using Google,Facebook and Twitter for LG’s Technology Conference  
-	Reported results by populating extensive spreadsheet with media trends and circulation  
-	Created the international Ogilvy events calendar combing large sets of data and events  
-	Researched online trends using ‘Google trends’ to generate topics for client bloggers 
-	Worked on creating an online advertising solution for Telstra's movie downloading function. 
- Assisting in events (Malaysian Kitchen food festival)  
 
Achievements: Supported the Haworth B2B Team on implementing all stages of an online digital media strategy for Tremble, a large GPS company. Key milestones included coverage reports, developing a new business proposal, conducting media analysis and developing the final pitch. Lead Marketing and Communication Volunteer The Cancer Council NSW April 2011  –  September 2011  (6 months) Wollongong Area, Australia For 6 months I volunteered with the Community Relations Manager at the Illawarra Cancer Council and supported the Marketing and Communications Department. 
 
Assistant Role:

* Analysed and populated large volunteer data bases  
* Media relations and stakeholder engagement (i98FM, Win News and The Mercury) 
* Updated and created content for social media 
* Producing and published web copy write and press releases 
 
ACHIEVEMENTS: Implemented a creative strategy to create awareness towards Daffodil Day. Cemented a deal with Lightsounds Wollongong to donate three days of lighting to turn the Breakwater Lighthouse, in Wollongong, yellow. Organised a media launch and invited the local community to view the first illumination. Summary Living in your comfort zone is probably safe, but definitely boring. That is why, chasing new opportunities to help customers to transform their businesses, I moved from Europe, where I had been awarded as the best global Google Sales Engineer, to California.  
 
I helped to move one of the biggest and most innovative European banks to the cloud. Now I am focusing on the retail industry, understanding their business challenges and helping them to transform the business, improving the way in which employees collaborate and share knowledge, working in the way they live, using the same tools that they use everyday to communicate with the people they love. 
 
If you are looking for an expert on Google technology for the Enterprise, with years of experience in the industry, I am definitely that person so, please, count on me. Summary Joined Google in 2006 coming from a Document Management Start-up where an individual had to wear multiple hats. Being a long time Googler, I had the privilege to see and participate actively in its fast growth. My initial focus was to scale our consumer support, process improvements, productivity measurement tools and business development activities. Back then, I was involved with consumer Gmail and Google Accounts as a product specialist (Usability, tech support, communications, reporting etc). Later on, I joined the Google Enterprise team (in its early days) as a Sales Engineer and managed the Sales Engineering team in EMEA. Currently I head up the Google For Work Post Sales Teams in NACE. 
 
Specialities:  
• Scale Pre-Sales and Post-Sales models. Strong Sales focus 
• People development, motivation and leadership.  
• Solution Selling.  
• Cloud computing and SaaS. 
• Business growth through Technology, #Innovation, #Transformation, #Mobility 
• Internet and online marketing strategies. 
• User experience, product usability.

Summary I am always looking to have an impact on the business, to inspire a team and to stay at the leading edge of technologies. I am an entrepreneur who leads by example and thrives in an agile, innovative and dynamic environment. 
 
In 1994 Olivier Colinet started as a scientist at the CERN in Geneva. He then joined several software players: either start-up organisations or market leaders. In 1996 Trilogy Software Inc., a Sales Force Automation software provider, established their EMEA headquarters in Paris. Olivier worked at Trilogy primarily in sales engineering and business development. In 1999 he became product manager at Hewlett Packard France, responsible for an EMEA legal time management system. He later acted as a senior pre-sales engineer at major players including HP Software, Documentum and EMC. Olivier developed an extensive knowledge in the positioning, development and implementation process of business software including business process management, document management, collaboration and search. 
 
Olivier joined Google in the summer of 2005 and helped getting the Google Enterprise business off the ground. In a high-growth environment, he built the EMEA technical team from scratch (both pre-sales & post-sales). The team is today widely recognized as one of Google’s top performers. Once a national level alpine ski competitor, Olivier enjoys all sorts of sports: alpine skiing, cycling, surfing and rugby. He loves travelling abroad and spending time with his international family. 
 
Specialties: Product Strategy, Go-To-Market Strategy, Adaptive Leadership, Business Development, Change Management, Partner Enablement, Pre-sales Management, Product Management, Cloud Computing, Saas, Paas, Big Data, Collaboration & Messaging, Enterprise Search, Business Process Management, Document Management.
